First, we need to look at what Parc des Princes is. Parc des Princes is a stadium located in Paris, France. It is the home stadium of Paris Saint-Germain, a professional soccer team. 

Next, we need to consider the timeframe of June 2020. During this time, the world was in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, and many businesses and public facilities were closed or operating with restrictions. 

Based on this information, we can conclude that it is unlikely that the Parc des Princes was fully operational during June of 2020. In fact, it is probable that the stadium was closed to the public or only open for limited purposes (such as training sessions for the soccer team) due to the pandemic.

Therefore, the correct answer to the question is (B) no.

First, we need to understand what the Parc des Princes is. The Parc des Princes is a soccer stadium located in Paris, France. Next, we need to determine the timeframe of the question, which is June 2020. During this time, the COVID-19 pandemic was ongoing and many countries, including France, had implemented restrictions on public gatherings and events. Knowing this, we can infer that there may have been restrictions on the use and operation of the stadium. 

To confirm our answer, we can do a quick internet search to see if there were any news articles or official announcements regarding the use of the Parc des Princes in June 2020. After searching, we find that the stadium was not fully operational during this time due to the pandemic. The French Football Federation had canceled the remaining matches of the 2019-2020 Ligue 1 season, which would have included games at the Parc des Princes. Additionally, the stadium was closed to the public and all events were cancelled or postponed. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) no.

First, we need to determine what the Parc des Princes is. The Parc des Princes is a stadium located in Paris, France. It is primarily used for soccer matches and is the home stadium of Paris Saint-Germain Football Club. 

Next, we need to consider the time period in question: June 2020. During this time, many places around the world were experiencing shutdowns and restrictions due to the COVID-19 pandemic. 

With this information in mind, we can now consider whether the Parc des Princes was fully operational during June 2020. "Fully operational" implies that the stadium was open and hosting events as usual. 

Based on news reports and official announcements, we know that France was under a national lockdown from mid-March until mid-May 2020. Even after the lockdown was lifted, there were restrictions on large gatherings and sporting events. 

In fact, the French soccer league (Ligue 1) was suspended in early March 2020 and did not resume until late August 2020, with matches played behind closed doors. 

Therefore, it is unlikely that the Parc des Princes was fully operational during June 2020, since sporting events and large gatherings were still restricted at that time. Hence, the correct answer is (B) no.

Next, we need to determine what "fully operational" means in this context. Generally, this would mean that the stadium is able to host events, has functioning facilities (such as restrooms and concessions), and is accessible to the public.

Finally, we need to consider the specific month of June 2020. This was a period of time during the COVID-19 pandemic, which affected many aspects of life in France and around the world.

Given these factors, we can conclude that the answer is (B) no, the Parc des Princes was not fully operational during June of 2020. Here's why:

- First, it is unlikely that any large public gathering places, such as stadiums, would have been allowed to host events during this time. France was under a nationwide lockdown from mid-March to mid-May, with restrictions gradually easing afterwards. However, even in June, many public spaces and cultural venues remained closed or had limitations on their capacity and operations.
- Second, even if some events were allowed to take place at the Parc des Princes in June, it is possible that the stadium would not have been able to accommodate them due to maintenance, renovations, or other factors. Without more specific information, we cannot say for certain whether the stadium was open to the public or not during this time. However, given the broader context of the pandemic and associated restrictions, it seems more likely that the stadium was not fully operational in June 2020.
